titleStmt.title: A most learned and eloquent speech, spoken or delivered in the Honourable House of Commons at Westminster, by the most learned lawyer Miles Corbet, Esq recorder of Great Yarmouth, and Burgess of the same, on the 31th day of July, 1647. taken in short-hand by Nocky, and Tom. Dunn, his clerks, and revised by John Tayler.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
Corbet, Miles, d. 1662, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by Miles Corbet; but a satire attributed to John Taylor by Wing (CD-ROM edition).
Conjectured place of publication and imprint date from Wing (CD-ROM edition).
Reproduction of original in the Newberry Library.
